intro: Diphasium multispicatum, commonly known as the many-spined diphasium, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its floral structure consists of two distinct phases, which is a unique feature among the genus Diphasium. The species is often found in coastal regions and is valued for its ornamental appearance and resilience.
